actions: Releases the exterior and muscle layer
Regulates and harmonizes ying qi and wei qi
clinical_manifestations: Exterior-deficient, wind-cold syndrome: headache, fever, perspiration, aversion to wind, stiff neck, nasal congestion, dry heaves, no particular thirst. Disharmony of the ying and wei levels: feverish sensations, spontaneous sweating, aversion to wind, thin white tongue coating, floating moderate pulse.
clinical_applications: Fever, common cold, influenza, bronchial asthma, allergic rhinitis, cervical spondylosis, and trigeminal neuralgia.
pharmacological_effects: Effect on sweating regulation, anti-inflammatory, analgesic, sedative, antipyretic, cough suppressing, anti-asthmatic.
research: Fever, common cold, bronchial asthma, allergic rhinitis, cervical spondylosis, trigeminal neuralgia.

actions: Releases the exterior and muscle layer
clinical_manifestations: Taiyang syndrome with wind-cold invasion: severe muscle stiffness of the neck and back, aversion to cold, with or without fever, aversion to wind, absence of perspiration and diarrhea.
clinical_applications: Fever, common cold, influenza, respiratory tract infections, allergic rhinitis, bronchial asthma, atrioventricular block, testicular pain, hernia, appendicitis, sciatica, allergic purpura, itching, frostbite, eczema, urticaria, enuresis, hyperactivity disorder
pharmacological_effects: antibacterial, antiviral, antipyretic, anti-inflammatory, cardiovascular, chronotropic and inotropic, immunostimulant, hepatoprotective
research: Fever, upper respiratory tract infection, meningitis, neck and shoulder pain, periarthritis of shoulder, soft tissue injuries, facial paralysis, Bell's palsy, tension headache, scleroderma, painful gynecomastia in liver cirrhosis, cataract surgery
